You can watch the gameplay trailer below:

For those out of the loop, a bit more DOOM: The Dark Ages gameplay was revealed yesterday via a behind-the-scenes technical demo.

item.title: Ubisoft is Cracking Down on Rainbow Six Siege Cheaters with New Rules
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ubisoft-rules-rainbow-six-siege-cheaters/

Ubisoft has released an update on the state of play with Rainbow Six Siege’s anti-cheat mechanics. In a release published on social media, the team revealed that things are getting tougher for the cheaters and malicious operators who want to spoil everyone else’s fun in the tactical FPS.

Most of the changes are live now and are being witnessed first-hand by streamers and pro players.

Getting Stricter

In the recent update from Ubisoft, it was explained that three major changes are being made to Rainbow Six Siege’s anti-cheat mechanics:

Botting: Permanent Ban on First Offence

‘We’ve heard your feedback and are updating our sanctioning systems for players detected for botting. Players will now be permanently banned on their first botting offense, rather than an initial 15-day ban followed by a permanent ban on the second offense. This stricter and more aggressive sanctioning has been made possible by an improved detection system that drastically reduces false positives.’

Cheater Match Cancellation and Live Kick

‘As of now, cheaters sanctioned by our systems will be kicked from their ongoing match and the match will be automatically cancelled.’

This was captured first-hand by a popular streamer:

So it turns out @Rainbow6Game is not messing around. It kicks the cheater and instantly cancels the match. No elo is taken from anyone and rollback commences for all who queued with the cheater that season. This is an unbelievable development and I am SO hype.

Encryption: Binary Hardening and Security

‘Along with Y9S4.2, we are shipping a new round of hardening and security updates, as we did in each patch (4.0, 4.1, 4.1.1) with major disruption and impact on the most prevalent cheat providers.’

Do you think these changes are a win, or are they likely to backfire on honest, legitimate players? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: South of Midnight Release Date Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/south-of-midnight-release-date-announced/

South of Midnight finally has a release date. During its 2025 Xbox Developer Direct on Thursday, developer Compulsion Games revealed that the game will launch on April 8.

When it launches, South of Midnight will be available on Xbox Series X|S, PC, and via Xbox Game Pass.

South of Midnight comes from the developers of We Happy Few, and takes players to the deep south of the United States. The game sees you play Hazel who becomes a Weaver after a storm hits her home of Prospero. According to Compulsion Games, a Weaver is a “magical mender of broken bonds and spirits”.

“Imbued with these new abilities, Hazel will confront and subdue dangerous creatures, untangle the webs of her own family’s shared past and -if she’s lucky – find her way to a place that feels like home,” the game’s description reads.

South of Midnight is Compulsion Games’ first release under the Xbox Game Studios umbrella. The studio had been independent before it was purchased by Xbox in 2018. The game itself was first announced in June 2023 before getting its first gameplay trailer in June 2024. That’s when the 2025 release window was also confirmed before getting a firm release date during the Developer Direct.

“At Compulsion Games, we love to craft around central themes,” game director Jasmin Roy said. “We’re lucky to have talent across all our disciplines that collaborate to give South of Midnight such a unique personality.”

In addition to a release date, Compulsion Games released the story trailer, giving players a deeper look at what they can expected when loading into South of Midnight.

item.title: Ninja Gaiden 2 Remastered Drops Today on Xbox – ‘Ninja Gaiden 2 Black’
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ninja-gaiden-2-black-remastered-xbox-game-pass/

It was just revealed at the Xbox Developer Direct showcase that Ninja Gaiden 2 Remake – known as ‘Ninja Gaiden 2 Black’ – drops today on Xbox Game Pass. This shadowdrop comes courtesy of Team Ninja, who revealed Ninja Gaiden 4 just moments before announcing the sudden and unexpected arrival of the rebuilt Ninja Gaiden 2.

You can play Ninja Gaiden 2 Black now, and it’s guaranteed to keep you busy until Ninja Gaiden 4 is released in Fall 2025.

Back in Black

Ninja Gaiden 2 Black has been fully built in UE5 by Team Ninja, honouring the ‘original style of the game’ with lush visuals. There will be a string of playable characters, including Ayane, Momiji, Rachel, and of course, Ryu Hayabusa.

Here’s the trailer for Ninja Gaiden 2 Black:

Ninja Gaiden 2 Black is available now on Xbox and PC, and it has been added to the Game Pass subscription service.

During the Xbox Developer Direct showcase, Team Ninja said:

We are happy to deliver this to the fans that have been dedicated to Ninja Gaiden over the years, as well as to newcomers of the series.

Ninja Gaiden 2 was originally released on the Xbox 360 way back in 2008, so this certainly is a blast from the past. Are you excited about the legendary game resurfacing? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Ninja Gaiden 4 Announced At Xbox Developer Direct
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ninja-gaiden-4-announced-at-xbox-developer-direct/

A new Ninja Gaiden game is on its away. From developers Team Ninja and PlatinumGames, Ninja Gaiden 4 was announced during the Xbox Developer Direct on Thursday.

The game’s announcement confirms the rumors that a “legendary Japanese IP” was going to see a game announced during the annual event.

“To all the ‘Master Ninja’ around the world, after more than 10 years, the wait is finally over,” Team Ninja’s Fumihiko Yasuda said. “We’re excited to announce Ninja Gaiden 4, a new mainline entry in this high-speed action series, where you become the ultimate ninja and take on relentless enemies in fierce combat.”

Ninja Gaiden will release in Fall 2025 on Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and PC. The game will also be available day one on Xbox Game Pass.

In addition to the announcement of Ninja Gaiden 4, Koei Tecmo announced Ninja Gaiden 2 Black. Built in Unreal Engine 5, Ninja Gaiden 2 Black is a remake of the game from 2008. To bridge the gap between now and the release of Ninja Gaiden 4, the remake is available starting today on PC, console, and Xbox Game Pass.

“I want to thank fans who have patiently waited for the return of the series. Their passion was the driving force behind the development of Ninja Gaiden 4 and our collaboration with PlatinumGames. I’m thrilled that we were finally able to make this announcement and hope it brings joy to our fans. We’ll continue working hard to meet your expectations.
